alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 9:33PM MDT until August 21 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following area, Chaves County Plains. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and rivers will be experiencing high and fast flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread light to moderate rain with isolated thunderstorms will continue through tonight. Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible with localized amounts up to 2 to 4 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
